shapes

Class Mouse

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Mouse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Mouse
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Captures input from the mouse. Mouse, along with Keyboard, is how you make your game interactive.

    For example, to make a shape move towards the point where the mouse is clicked, you would write:

    shape.move(shape.towards(Mouse.clickLocation(), 10);

        public Mouse()

    • Method Detail

      • clickLocation

        public static Point clickLocation()
        Returns the location of a mouse click. If the mouse button is pressed and then the mouse is dragged (without releasing the button), the new location of the mouse is returned. Unlike mouseLocation(), this function will return null if the mouse button isn't pressed.
        Returns:
        the location of the mouse cursor, if the mouse button is pressed. Returns null if the mouse button isn't pressed.

      • mouseLocation

        public static Point mouseLocation()
        Returns the location of the mouse cursor. Unlike clickLocation(), this function will return the mouse's location even if the mouse button isn't pressed.
        Returns:
        the location of the mouse cursor. If the mouse cursor hasn't yet entered the game window, returns null. If the cursor was in the window but has left, returns the location of the mouse just before it left the window.

      • isInWindow

        public static boolean isInWindow()
        Returns whether the mouse cursor is in the game window.
        Returns:
        false if the mouse cursor is outside the game window, true if inside.
